solution_line_template: The tilled land will take up half the area, and the trellises and raised beds will be the other half. Each half is {total_garden_area} / {half_divisor} = <<{total_garden_area}/{half_divisor}={remaining_area_for_trellises_and_beds}>>{remaining_area_for_trellises_and_beds} square feet.
The trellises will take up {trellis_fraction} of the remaining land, so the raised beds will take {whole_fraction} - {trellis_fraction} = {raised_bed_fraction_of_remaining} of the remaining land.

So the total area of the raised bed area will be {remaining_area_for_trellises_and_beds} square feet * ({raised_bed_fraction_of_remaining}) = <<{remaining_area_for_trellises_and_beds}*({raised_bed_fraction_of_remaining})={raised_bed_area}>>{raised_bed_area} square feet.
